<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 293]]<|/det|>
9709/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 907, 319]]<|/det|>
May/June 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 902, 92]]<|/det|>
Use logarithms to solve the equation \(12^{x} = 3^{2x + 1}\). Give your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 88, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 406, 102]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = \frac{2 + 3\ln x}{1 + 2x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 114, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point \(\left(1, \frac{2}{3}\right)\). Give your answer in the form \(ax + by + c = 0\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 393, 92]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 100, 608, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = 2x^{3} + 3x^{2} + kx - 30,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 620, 145]]<|/det|>
where \(k\) is a constant. It is given that \((x - 3)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 159, 146, 177]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 159, 316, 177]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 159, 920, 177]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 368, 143, 387]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 368, 843, 387]]<|/det|>
Hence find the quotient when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x - 3)\) and factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 680, 141, 698]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 680, 635, 698]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(a\) is one of the roots of the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 707, 920, 740]]<|/det|>
Given also that the equation \(|4y - 5| = a\) is satisfied by two real values of \(y\), find these two values of \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 724, 920, 742]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 760, 920, 777]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 797, 920, 814]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 833, 920, 850]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 870, 920, 887]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 944, 126, 958]]<|/det|>
<label>©</label>

<label>UCLES</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[175, 944, 225, 958]]<|/det|>
2023

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 944, 548, 958]]<|/det|>
9709/21/M/J/23

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[821, 944, 920, 958]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Turn over

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[306, 88, 722, 219]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 240, 564, 260]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[381, 266, 615, 286]]<|/det|>
\[x = 4\mathrm{e}^{2t},\qquad y = 5\mathrm{e}^{-t}\cos 2t,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 293, 547, 314]]<|/det|>
for \(- \frac{1}{4}\pi \leqslant t \leqslant \frac{1}{4}\pi\). The curve has a maximum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 336, 146, 354]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 330, 477, 359]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\) in terms of \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 336, 920, 355]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 806, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of \(M\), giving each coordinate correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Express 7 cos \(\theta + 24 \sin \theta\) in the form \(R \cos (\theta - \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^\circ < \alpha < 90^\circ\). Give the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 460, 185, 477]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[181, 460, 635, 477]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(7 \cos \theta + 24 \sin \theta = 18\) for \(0^\circ < \theta < 360^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 460, 920, 479]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 494, 92]]<|/det|>
As \(\beta\) varies, the greatest possible value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 98, 599, 134]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{150}{7\cos\frac{1}{2}\beta + 24\sin\frac{1}{2}\beta + 50}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 144, 292, 163]]<|/det|>
is denoted by \(V\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 175, 920, 210]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(V\) and determine the smallest positive value of \(\beta\) (in degrees) for which the value of \(V\) occurs.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 193, 920, 211]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 74, 569, 92]]<|/det|>
